textBeforeTable: Requirements: The class consists of lectures and case=20 discussions.  You should form groups consisting of approximately 4 st= udents=20 each for the purpose of writing up and discussing the cases.  &n= bsp;=20 Each group will be required to turn in a 3 page executive summary of their= =20 analysis along with the appropriate exhibits that provides more details ab= out=20 their work.  Each student is expected to be actively involved in the = case=20 discussions.  If for any reason you are not adequately prepared to=20 contribute to the discussion in a class, please let me know before class a= nd I=20 will not call on you.=20 Guest speakers: When we have guest speakers, the appropriate dre= ss is=20 business casual.=20 Readings: Valuation: The Art and Science of Corporate Investment= =20 Decisions, (Titman and Martin) and Case Packet.  The books and cases = will=20 be available at the University Coop.  I will post lecture notes and o= ther=20 readings on Blackboard.=20 Grades: 35% case discussion and write-ups, 50% exams, 15%=20 participation=20 Tentative Schedule: Please note, some of the dates are likely to cha= nge=20 due to scheduling conflicts with our guest lecturers.=20 Chapters 9-13 in the Grinblatt and Titman text --- although we will = be=20 spending considerable time discussing these concepts, you should underst= and=20 how to estimate cash flows and discount rates and be somewhat familiar w= ith=20 certainty equivalent cash flows and how they relate to forward prices.=20 Chapters 14-17 in the
